commit_message:
libvirt: Support boot from volume stable device instance rescue

This change introduces support for boot from volume stable device
instance rescue to the Libvirt driver by reporting the
supports_bfv_rescue capability.

The only change to the rescue method within the Libvirt driver is the
introduction of a call to utils.get_bdm_image_metadata when we fail to
lookup the image metadata of an instance. This function allowing us to
extract image metadata if any is present from the provided
block_device_mapping.

Implements: blueprint virt-bfv-instance-rescue
Change-Id: I99194539bd77790896a79fee47978905cba99bee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/701431/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "supports_bfv_rescue": True, block_device_mapping = driver.block_device_info_get_mapping( block_device_info) if self._is_booted_from_volume(block_device_info): bdm = block_device.get_root_bdm(block_device_mapping) volume = self._volume_api.get(context, bdm.volume_id) volume_image_metadata = volume.get('volume_image_metadata', {}) image_id = volume_image_metadata.get('image_id') try: image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_image_ref( context, self._image_api, image_id) except Exception: pass

commit_message:
Handle new is_volume_backend join column query

If 'is_volume_backend' column is passed in getting instance list,
it will check if the instance is booted from volume or not and
accordingly is_volume_backend attribute will be set in the
DB Instance model which will later be used to set
is_volume_backend attribute in the Instance versioned object.

Partial-Bug: #1715570
Change-Id: I4fd75a70f096fe29489b12f60a2a913b783d1d1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/694462/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'is_volume_backed' in manual_joins: bfv_instances_uuids = _get_volume_backed_instances(context, uuids) else: bfv_instances_uuids = set() if 'is_volume_backed' in manual_joins: inst['is_volume_backed'] = inst['uuid'] in bfv_instances_uuidsdef _get_volume_backed_instances(context, instance_uuids): uuids = [] query = model_query(context, models.Instance, (models.Instance.uuid,), read_deleted="yes" ).join(( models.BlockDeviceMapping, models.Instance.uuid == models.BlockDeviceMapping.instance_uuid)).filter(and_(( models.BlockDeviceMapping.boot_index == 0), (models.Instance.uuid.in_(instance_uuids)), (models.BlockDeviceMapping.destination_type == 'volume'))) for instance in query.all(): uuids.append(instance[0]) return uuids If columns_to_join contains 'metadata', 'system_metadata', 'fault', 'is_volume_backed' or 'pci_devices' those columns are removed from columns_to_join and added to a manual_joins list to be used with the _instances_fill_metadata method. for column in ('metadata', 'system_metadata', 'pci_devices', 'fault', 'is_volume_backed'):
deleted_lines: If columns_to_join contains 'metadata', 'system_metadata', 'fault', or 'pci_devices' those columns are removed from columns_to_join and added to a manual_joins list to be used with the _instances_fill_metadata method. for column in ('metadata', 'system_metadata', 'pci_devices', 'fault'):

commit_message:
Populate 'updated_at' when aggregate is updated

Showing an exist aggregate, the "updated_at" in it's resonse body
is always NULL. We will save the last updated time of aggregate
in following cases:

  add_host
  delete_host

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Closes-Bug: #1663456
Change-Id: I61fcdf0226a88edd466f47e4dd20625143a53c5a

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2019-08-22 07:29:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/76d1da0e371e27eda0f8ed58539840b9490cc87c', 'message': 'Ignore root_gb for BFV in simple tenant usage API

Added "is_volume_backed" field in "Instance which will be set
to True/False depending on whether the instance is booted from
volume or not.
This attribute should be set in the expected_attrs and passed
to InstanceList method like
"objects.InstanceList.get_active_by_window_joined" when you want
to get a list of instances and iterate over the instance to find
whether an instance is booted from volume or not otherwise you
will need to query bdms for each instance thereby impacting the
performance of the simple tenant usage API.

Co-Authored-By: Bhagyashri Shewale <bhagyashri.shewale@nttdata.com>
Closes-Bug: #1715570
Change-Id: I2ea3e99ad04702787fc707debe11367437755be0

commit_message:
Ignore root_gb if instance is booted from volume

If instance is booted from volume, disk usage calculation should
exclude flavor.root_gb in case of Simple Tenant Usage API and
Instance Usage Audit Period Task.

Co-Authored-By: Bhagyashri Shewale <bhagyashri.shewale@nttdata.com>
Closes-Bug: #1715570
Change-Id: I2ea3e99ad04702787fc707debe11367437755be0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/612626/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.compute import utils as compute_utils is_volume_backed = compute_utils.is_volume_backed_instance( context, instance) if is_volume_backed: info['local_gb'] = instance.flavor.ephemeral_gb else: info['local_gb'] = (instance.flavor.root_gb + instance.flavor.ephemeral_gb)

subject: Instance object changes for the new 'is_volume_backed' expected_attr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-15 07:18:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/482bb0d53c29e1fde9e9dd4cb26de155d17ab708', 'message': 'Instance object changes for the new 'is_volume_backed' expected_attr

Allow "is_volume_backend" to be passed as expected_attrs so that it
can set "is_volume_backed" attribute to True/False in Instance object
depending on whether it is booted from volume or not.

'is_volume_backend' column doesn't exists in the instances db table,
it's just defined as an optional field which will be included in the
db query only in special cases like getting list of instances for a
specific period for now.

Partial-Bug: #1715570
Change-Id: Ic71cdae7d10a0af7fffa596702b621695331252e

commit_message:
Instance object changes for the new 'is_volume_backed' expected_attr

Allow "is_volume_backend" to be passed as expected_attrs so that it
can set "is_volume_backed" attribute to True/False in Instance object
depending on whether it is booted from volume or not.

'is_volume_backend' column doesn't exists in the instances db table,
it's just defined as an optional field which will be included in the
db query only in special cases like getting list of instances for a
specific period for now.

Partial-Bug: #1715570
Change-Id: Ic71cdae7d10a0af7fffa596702b621695331252e

added_lines: exp_cols.remove('is_volume_backed') @mock.patch.object(db, 'instance_get_by_uuid') @mock.patch('nova.objects.BlockDeviceMappingList.get_by_instance_uuid') def test_load_is_volume_backed(self, mock_bdm, mock_get): fake_uuid = self.fake_instance['uuid'] bdm_list = [objects.BlockDeviceMappingList( objects=[objects.BlockDeviceMapping(instance_uuid=fake_uuid, destination_type='volume', boot_index=0)])] mock_bdm.side_effect = bdm_list mock_get.side_effect = [self.fake_instance] inst = objects.Instance.get_by_uuid(self.context, fake_uuid) self.assertTrue(hasattr(inst, 'is_volume_backed')) self.assertTrue(inst.is_volume_backed) def test_load_is_volume_backed_as_false(self): # for non-BFV instance 'is_volume_backed' = False inst = objects.Instance._from_db_object( self.context, objects.Instance(), self.fake_instance, expected_attrs='is_volume_backed') self.assertFalse(inst.is_volume_backed) @mock.patch.object(db, 'instance_get_by_uuid') @mock.patch('nova.objects.BlockDeviceMappingList.get_by_instance_uuid') def test_get_active_by_window_joined_bfv(self, mock_bdm, mock_get): bfv_instance_uuid = self.fake_instance(1)['uuid'] bdm_list = [objects.BlockDeviceMappingList( objects=[objects.BlockDeviceMapping( instance_uuid=bfv_instance_uuid, destination_type='volume', boot_index=0)])] mock_bdm.side_effect = bdm_list mock_get.side_effect = [self.fake_instance(1)] fakes = [self.fake_instance(1), self.fake_instance(2)] # NOTE(mriedem): Send in a timezone-naive datetime since the # InstanceList.get_active_by_window_joined method should convert it # to tz-aware for the DB API call, which we'll assert with our stub. dt = timeutils.utcnow() with mock.patch.object( db, 'instance_get_active_by_window_joined', return_value=fakes): inst_list = objects.InstanceList.get_active_by_window_joined( self.context, dt, expected_attrs=['metadata', 'is_volume_backed']) for fake, obj in zip(fakes, inst_list.objects): self.assertIsInstance(obj, instance.Instance) self.assertEqual(fake['uuid'], obj.uuid) if fake['uuid'] == bfv_instance_uuid: self.assertTrue(obj.is_volume_backed) else: self.assertFalse(obj.is_volume_backed)

commit_message:
Remove zVM requirement from the top level requirements.

Requirements for just one hypervisor driver should not appear in
requirements.txt. This has been a long standing policy. Otherwise
we're forcing deployers to install a dependancy that the vast
majority of them will never use. Instead, dynamically load the
depedancy at run time.

Change-Id: I6af2fe2a1d915ffc86ad3d73aa5f04a09a93d867
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/677870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import importutils # Import zvmconnector dynamically so it is not a dependancy for # all nova users. connector = importutils.import_module('zvmconnector').connector

subject: clean up orphan instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-29 07:26:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/408155ff573c09aea32a5480533be0f10735cded', 'message': 'Clean up orphan instances

This peaordic task instances that are listed in the hypervisor
on a given compute node but are not listed in the nova database
as running on that compute node.

Instances in the middle of migration or waiting for resize/migrate
confirmation will not be destroyed.

bp: periodic-orphan-instances-delete

Change-Id: Ie9fe8bd25f4625161d529ecdcc2822fc9d614083
Co-Authored-By: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-01-29 08:15:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0df759655930e8c9df975c16217b22f4ca3df9f1', 'message': "Clean up orphan instances

  The existing _cleanup_running_deleted_instances() periodic audit
calls _running_deleted_instances, and finds instances that were
deleted, and have 'deleted' attribute in database.

  There may be a few ways an instance is not listed in the Database
at all. For example,there is some sort of failure after
live-migration started and not cleaning up completely in
live-migration rollback due to unhandled exception. The
live-migration completes. The result are 2 identical VMs -- one of
them becomes an orphan that is not tracked in nova but is still
seen by libvirt.

  This commit introduce a new periodic clean task to query vm from
libvirt and deleted them if they are not tracking by Nova.

bp: periodic-orphan-instances-delete

Change-Id: Ie9fe8bd25f4625161d529ecdcc2822fc9d614083
Co-Authored-By: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>

"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2019-03-28 08:09:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/010129233148d586004fb798a08f062be9379637', 'message': "Clean up orphan instances

The existing _cleanup_running_deleted_instances() periodic audit
calls _running_deleted_instances, and finds instances that were
deleted, and have 'deleted' attribute in database.

There may be a few ways an instance is not listed in the Database
at all. For example,there is some sort of failure after live-migration
started and not cleaning up completely in live-migration rollback due
to unhandled exception. The live-migration completes. The result are
2 identical VMs -- one of them becomes an orphan that is not tracked
in nova but is still running and consuming resources.

This commit introduce a new periodic clean task to query vm from
libvirt and deleted them if they are not tracking by Nova. This is
configurable via option running_orphan_instance_action.

Closes-Bug: #1820802

Change-Id: Ie9fe8bd25f4625161d529ecdcc2822fc9d614083
Co-Authored-By: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2019-04-01 07:48:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f46f306a71a35cbb41e881d2a6b97c7255fd5144', 'message': "Clean up orphan instances

The existing _cleanup_running_deleted_instances() periodic audit
calls _running_deleted_instances, and finds instances that were
deleted, and have 'deleted' attribute in database.

There may be an instance is not listed in the Database at all. For
example,there is some sort of failure after live-migration started
and not cleaning up completely in live-migration rollback due to
unhandled exception. The live-migration completes. The result are
2 identical VMs -- one of them becomes an orphan that is not tracked
as running in source host but is still running and consuming
resources.

And if delete an instance while the nova-compute service is down,
the instance will became orphan and is not tracked by nova database.

This commit introduce a new periodic clean task to query vm from
libvirt and deleted them if they are not tracking by Nova. Which
action is taken is configurable via option
'running_orphan_instance_action'.

Change-Id: Ie9fe8bd25f4625161d529ecdcc2822fc9d614083
Closes-Bug: #1820802

"}, {'number': 18, 'created': '2019-04-24 23:16:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3f7d55cf6218939826cf8c86f3e451cdb55ea31a', 'message': "Clean up orphan instances

The existing _cleanup_running_deleted_instances() periodic audit
calls _running_deleted_instances, and finds instances that were
deleted, and have 'deleted' attribute in database.

There may be an instance is not listed in the Database at all. For
example,there is some sort of failure after live-migration started
and not cleaning up completely in live-migration rollback due to
unhandled exception. The live-migration completes. The result are
2 identical VMs -- one of them becomes an orphan that is not tracked
as running in source host but is still running and consuming
resources.

And if delete an instance while the nova-compute service is down,
the instance will became orphan and is not tracked by nova database.

This commit introduce a new periodic clean task to query vm from
libvirt and deleted them if they are not tracking by Nova. Which
action is taken is configurable via option
'running_orphan_instance_action'.

Change-Id: Ie9fe8bd25f4625161d529ecdcc2822fc9d614083
Closes-Bug: #1820802

"}, {'number': 37, 'created': '2019-09-05 08:33:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/21fc1bf97ece04e3607bec49ec9e199ea983ba1b', 'message': 'clean up orphan instances

The existing _cleanup_running_deleted_instances() periodic audit
calls _running_deleted_instances, and finds instances that were
deleted, and have 'deleted' attribute in database.

There may be an instance is not listed in the Database at all. For

unhandled exception. The live-migration completes. The result are

as running in source host but is still running and consuming
resources.

And if delete an instance while the nova-compute service is down, and
the database is purged, the instance will became orphan and is not
tracked by nova database.

_cleanup_running_deleted_instances periodic task.

commit_message:
clean up orphan instances

The existing _cleanup_running_deleted_instances() periodic audit
calls _running_deleted_instances, and finds instances that were
deleted, and have 'deleted' attribute in database.

If delete an instance while the nova-compute service is down, and
the database is purged, the instance will became orphan and is not
tracked by nova database.

This commit add "shutdown_unknown" and "reap_unknown" options to
_cleanup_running_deleted_instances periodic task.

Change-Id: Ie9fe8bd25f4625161d529ecdcc2822fc9d614083
Closes-Bug: #1820802

commit_message:
Don't create instance_extra entry for deleted instance

When updating an instance, if there is no entry for an instance,
nova create a new entry for it. For somehow, if updating comes after
the instance has been deleted (its entry would be soft-deleted),
nova would create a new entry for the deleted instance currently.
It causes instance_extra entry duplicate.

For those deleted instance, we shouldn't create a new entry,
just let's skip the "update".

Change-Id: I28e3fb3ef20508d83f30ae6af8bf94967486f6c8
Closes-bug: #1651319

commit_message:
Check enable_new_services option in service.py

In order to make enable_new_services option configurable per host
not per process which can directly access to database, nova should
check enable_new_services option before try to access database or
call rpc for conductor.

Change-Id: I0f1801b7a840afd557013e31d1cbc91511e0ff81
Closes-Bug: #1747484

commit_message:
VMware:fix get VM root device conditional verify

the old code in "class /nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py method : get_vmdk_info ",
verifies the root device uses "path.basename == root_disk+".vmdk",
but when one snapshots a VM ,
the root device has an different filepath from a normal image filepath,
it's like "root_disk+"-"+"*.vmdk".
This patch enables get_root_device() to work for both normal and snapshot filepaths.
for the case of VM snapshot of VMware, because the format is
like "root_disk_<number>.vmdk".

Change-Id: I0a8046e467ed60d707ab7636872b7956bde9e599
Closes-Bug: #1634340

commit_message:
Add warning message for cache_utils connection failure

We don't provide enough information to pinpoint something like a
memcache connection info. Leave some breadcrumbs to help users.

Change-Id: I0ff2b3c738979faf5393de5e6ccfc4f93c15e500
Closes-Bug: #1715785

commit_message:
Use Placement API to check resource usage

Use the following API to confirm that resource usage is
correctly reflected at create server.
Test is choice small flavor at create server and
choice large flavor at create server
<https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#list-resource-provider-usages>

Change-Id: I7ffe98eeb3ed0723584b08b233605231e9a91c12

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # from nova.tests.functional.api import client from nova import context from nova import objects from nova.tests.functional.api.openstack.placement import test_report_client from nova.tests.functional import test_servers class PlacementUsagesTest(test_servers.ServersTestBase): def setUp(self): super(PlacementUsagesTest, self).setUp() self.ctxt = context.get_admin_context() compute_node = objects.ComputeNodeList.get_all(self.ctxt)[0] compute_node.vcpus = 10 compute_node.memory_mb = 32768 compute_node.save() def test_small_flavor(self): report = test_report_client.NoAuthReportClient() # Update compute node status compute_node = objects.ComputeNodeList.get_all(self.ctxt)[0] report.update_compute_node(compute_node) # Create Server(choice flavor[0]) image = self.api.get_images()[0] flavor = self.api.get_flavors()[0] post = {"server": {"name": "test", "flavorRef": flavor['id'], "imageRef": image['id']}} created_server = self.api.post_server(post) server_uuid = created_server['id'] found_server = self._wait_for_state_change(created_server, 'BUILD') self.assertEqual('ACTIVE', found_server['status']) # Update allocations instance_list = objects.InstanceList.get_by_host( self.ctxt, compute_node.host) instance = instance_list[0] report.update_instance_allocation(compute_node, instance, 1) # Check usages url = '/resource_providers/%s/usages' % compute_node.uuid resp = report.get(url).json() self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['VCPU'], flavor['vcpus']) self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['MEMORY_MB'], flavor['ram']) self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['DISK_GB'], flavor['disk']) # Delete server self._delete_server(server_uuid) # Delete allocations report.update_instance_allocation(compute_node, instance, -1) # Check usages url = '/resource_providers/%s/usages' % compute_node.uuid resp = report.get(url).json() self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['VCPU'], 0) self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['MEMORY_MB'], 0) self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['DISK_GB'], 0) def test_Large_flavor(self): report = test_report_client.NoAuthReportClient() # Update compute node status compute_node = objects.ComputeNodeList.get_all(self.ctxt)[0] report.update_compute_node(compute_node) # Create Server(choice flavor[4]) image = self.api.get_images()[0] flavor = self.api.get_flavors()[4] post = {"server": {"name": "test", "flavorRef": flavor['id'], "imageRef": image['id']}} created_server = self.api.post_server(post) server_uuid = created_server['id'] found_server = self._wait_for_state_change(created_server, 'BUILD') self.assertEqual('ACTIVE', found_server['status']) # Update allocations instance_list = objects.InstanceList.get_by_host( self.ctxt, compute_node.host) instance = instance_list[0] report.update_instance_allocation(compute_node, instance, 1) # Check usages url = '/resource_providers/%s/usages' % compute_node.uuid resp = report.get(url).json() self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['VCPU'], flavor['vcpus']) self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['MEMORY_MB'], flavor['ram']) self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['DISK_GB'], flavor['disk']) # Delete server self._delete_server(server_uuid) # Delete allocations report.update_instance_allocation(compute_node, instance, -1) # Check usages url = '/resource_providers/%s/usages' % compute_node.uuid resp = report.get(url).json() self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['VCPU'], 0) self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['MEMORY_MB'], 0) self.assertEqual(resp['usages']['DISK_GB'], 0)

commit_message:
Inline trace_request_filter

The logic for tracing a request filter was very simple. Rather than
having a decorator and remembering to put it on new filter methods, move
the logic inline in process_reqspec.

This will also make it easier to include things that aren't plain
methods in ALL_REQUEST_FILTERS.

Change-Id: Ia9cad7dfa852a61b294848249916fbf3aa70e4d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/666663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: timer = timeutils.StopWatch() for filt in ALL_REQUEST_FILTERS: with timer: try: ran = filt(ctxt, request_spec) finally: if ran: # Only log info if the filter was enabled and not # excluded for some reason LOG.debug('Request filter %r took %.1f seconds', filt.__name__, timer.elapsed())
deleted_lines: def trace_request_filter(fn): @functools.wraps(fn) def wrapper(ctxt, request_spec): timer = timeutils.StopWatch() ran = False with timer: try: ran = fn(ctxt, request_spec) finally: if ran: # Only log info if the filter was enabled and not # excluded for some reason LOG.debug('Request filter %r took %.1f seconds', fn.__name__, timer.elapsed()) return ran return wrapper @trace_request_filter@trace_request_filter@trace_request_filter for filter in ALL_REQUEST_FILTERS: filter(ctxt, request_spec)

commit_message:
Whether to use config drive depends on instance.configdrive

Use instance.config_drive in db to decide whether to create
a config drive or not. Combine cfg with instance.config_drive
to decide how to change instance.config_drive in db.

Change-Id: I924a381ebc7bb40bc98852fe0f19ec0f8d836883
Closes-Bug: #1241806
Closes-Bug: #1303714

commit_message:
Block automatic transport_url update for cell0

nova-manage cell_v2 map_cell0 creates the cell0 mapping based
on database_connection alone and transport_url is set to "none://".
As cell0 does not contain any message queues unlike other
cells and by default, its configuration is the same as that of
the nova_API cell, when running the nova-manage cell_v2 update_cell
command it doesn't make sense to always pass "--transport_url="none://"
to avoid overwriting from the api.conf. This patch disallows
transport_url update for cell0.

Change-Id: I1893009e7e7eda576fd5b4ee9b1141ae00ff2b84
Closes-Bug: #1794493

commit_message:
Raise Exception instead of Exception method call

This patch replace in the unit test an Exception()
method call to raise Exception().
In another patch[1] require to track the raised exception for
notification transformation implementation, but the Exception() only a
method call, not contains real error informations, however we need it.
Instead I raised a real Exception which are trackable, contains
informations from raised exceptions and appropriate for the target.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/482629/

Change-Id: I304efe1146d7f80e0d2d44888d4efef49fb9ec0b

subject: created AggregateSubnetAvailabilityFilter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-01-25 10:38:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d5c3c37936c0465eac22075d6913f80e908fbf4b', 'message': 'created AggregateSubnetAvailabilityFilter

This is a filter that looks at the available ip capacity for individual subnets.

It acomplishes this by looking at a "subnets" key that needs to be set as a property of aggregates that hosts are members of and in order to pass the filter one of the subnets the host has access to must not be out of IP capacity.
The value for "subnets" should be a comma seperated list of subnet names that hosts within the aggregate have access to.

This is effectively a work around for https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-pike

Change-Id: Ifa73d40763917cd9dbcbff75a8234c11ccdc5ed0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-01-25 17:39:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d78d8817f45125654abe097d9264b7abab0b8395', 'message': 'created AggregateSubnetAvailabilityFilter

This is a filter that looks at the available ip capacity for individual subnets.

It acomplishes this by looking at a "subnets" key that needs to be set as a property of aggregates that hosts are members of and in order to pass the filter one of the subnets the host has access to must not be out of IP capacity.
The value for "subnets" should be a comma seperated list of subnet names that hosts within the aggregate have access to.

This is effectively a work around for https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-pike

Change-Id: Ifa73d40763917cd9dbcbff75a8234c11ccdc5ed0

commit_message:
created AggregateSubnetAvailabilityFilter

This is a filter that looks at the available ip capacity for individual subnets.

It acomplishes this by looking at a "subnets" key that needs to be set as a property of aggregates that hosts are members of and in order to pass the filter one of the subnets the host has access to must not be out of IP capacity.
The value for "subnets" should be a comma seperated list of subnet names that hosts within the aggregate have access to.

This is effectively a work around for https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-pike

Change-Id: Ifa73d40763917cd9dbcbff75a8234c11ccdc5ed0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/633178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2011-2019 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova.scheduler import filters from nova.network.neutronv2 import api as neutronapi class AggregateSubnetAvailabilityFilter(filters.BaseHostFilter): """Filters out hosts that don't have available IP capacity""" # list of hosts doesn't change within a request run_filter_once_per_request = True RUN_ON_REBUILD = False def host_passes(self, host_state, spec_obj): # Add subnet ip availability to spec_obj if it isn't there if not hasattr(spec_obj, 'subnet_ip_availability'): ip_availability_dict = {} neutron_api = neutronapi.get_client(spec_obj.obj_context) neutron_api.list_network_ip_availabilities() for network in d.get('network_ip_availabilities', []): for subnet in network.get('subnet_ip_availability'): subnet_name = subnet['subnet_name'] remaining_ips = subnet['total_ips'] - subnet['used_ips'] ip_availability_dict[subnet_name] = remaining_ips spec_obj.subnet_ip_availability = ip_availability_dict # Get subnets for the host from the "subnets" aggregrate for agg in host_state.aggregates: metadata = agg.get('_obj_metadata', {}) subnets = metadata.get('subnets', '').split(',') # Check ip availability of the host's subnets for subnet in subnets: if spec_obj.subnet_ip_availability.get(subnet, 0) > 0: return True return False

commit_message:
Fix 'has_calls' method calls in unit tests

The 'has_calls' method does not exist in assertion methods of mock.
Replace the 'has_calls' method with an 'assert_has_calls' method or
an 'assert_called_once_with' method.
Add an 'assertEqual' check before an 'assert_has_calls' method.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(takashin): The conflict is due to not having the following change
in stable/ocata.

    Id7a05b579ead6ac5445ca5b1eeab6d223d545a6c

commit_message:
Fix non-existent method of Mock

There is no method called_once_with() in Mock object.
Use assert_called_once_with() or assert_has_calls() instead.

commit_message:
Fix non-existent method of Mock

There is no method called_once_with() in Mock object.
Use assert_called_once_with() or assert_has_calls() instead.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
    nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_vif.py

commit_message:
Fix misuse of nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims

The nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims returns True or False.
It does not assert anything.
So the return value should be asserted in tests.

Add assertTrue where the nova.objects.base.obj_equal_prims is called.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/objects/test_build_request.py

NOTE(takashin): The conflict is due to not having the following change
in stable/ocata.

    I1121eaf24856dcb74f07c224531a821b3cdc46fc

commit_message:
Add database schema upgrade check

Add database schema upgrade checks
in the 'nova-status upgrade check' command.

Change-Id: I8aa48f9608a992e1739268a8378f1cf805b8dca9
Closes-Bug: #1833278

added_lines: class TestVersion(test.NoDBTestCase): @mock.patch.object(migration, '_get_migrate_repo_path', return_value='/fake/path') @mock.patch.object(versioning_api, 'version') def test_version(self, mock_version, mock_get_path): database = 'fake' migration.version(database) mock_get_path.assert_called_once_with(database) mock_version.assert_called_once_with('/fake/path')

subject: Fix default values in update_cell command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-05-31 05:06:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/45eed1339dc7a1b8c69d1bb41cd46ac057c5ccd9', 'message': 'Fix default values in update_cell command

If specifying either --transport-url or --database_connection
only in the nova-manage cell_v2 update_cell command,
the value in the configuration file is used for the option
that is not specified.
It causes the following error.

The specified transport_url and/or database_connection
combination already exists for another cell
with uuid 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

So change the default value to the original value of
the cell mapping instead of the value
in the configuration file.

Change-Id: If5b5bbdc928594d0f53a50dac7349af694a07b7c
Closes-Bug: #1829852
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-06-11 03:55:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9f48952d0291d01a86f90d9e8c56c8566d1caefc', 'message': "Fix default values in update_cell command

If specifying either --transport-url or --database_connection
only in the nova-manage cell_v2 update_cell command,
the value in the configuration file is used for the option
that is not specified.
It causes the following error.

The specified transport_url and/or database_connection
combination already exists for another cell
with uuid 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

So change the command as follows:

* Use the value in the configuration file
  if neither transport_url or database_connection is specified.
* Keep the value as it is if 'keep' is specified
  for transport_url or database_connection.
* The command exits with a return code of 6
  if either transport_url or database_connection is specified
  and the other is not specified.

Change-Id: If5b5bbdc928594d0f53a50dac7349af694a07b7c
Closes-Bug: #1829852
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-06-11 05:04:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0866439ad097e7914068767133352b6bd2d5ddc8', 'message': "Fix default values in update_cell command

If specifying either --transport-url or --database_connection
only in the nova-manage cell_v2 update_cell command,
the value in the configuration file is used for the option
that is not specified.
It causes the following error.

The specified transport_url and/or database_connection
combination already exists for another cell
with uuid 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

So change the command as follows:

* Use the value in the configuration file
  if neither transport_url or database_connection is specified.
* Keep the value as it is if 'keep' is specified

commit_message:
Fix default values in update_cell command

If specifying either --transport-url or --database_connection
only in the nova-manage cell_v2 update_cell command,
the value in the configuration file is used for the option
that is not specified.
It causes the following error.

The specified transport_url and/or database_connection
combination already exists for another cell
with uuid 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

So change the command as follows:

* Use the value in the configuration file
  if neither transport_url or database_connection is specified.
* Keep the value as it is if 'keep' is specified
  for transport_url or database_connection.
* The command exits with a return code of 6
  if either transport_url or database_connection is specified
  and the other is not specified.

Change-Id: If5b5bbdc928594d0f53a50dac7349af694a07b7c
Closes-Bug: #1829852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/662383/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: transport_url = transport_url or CONF.transport_url db_connection = db_connection or CONF.database.connection

commit_message:
Add a live migration regression test

Add a live migration regression functional test
for bug 1815153 and fix some nits in
I2131558f0edfe603ee1e8d8bae66a3caf5182a58.

Change-Id: I181dff387e78064b64d46c31b35c419e527fcac8
Related-Bug: #1815153
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/00/641200/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Tests the following three cases here. * Live migration without a destination host. The following case is not tested here because compute_id = self.api.get_services( self.api.put_service(compute_id, {'forced_down': 'true'}) self.assertFalse(reqspec.is_bfv) def test_live_migrate(self): server = self._create_server() original_host = server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'] target_host = self._get_target_host(original_host) self._remove_is_bfv_in_request_spec(server['id']) # Force a target host down compute_id = self.api.get_services( host=target_host, binary='nova-compute')[0]['id'] self.compute[target_host].stop() self.api.put_service(compute_id, {'forced_down': 'true'}) # Live migrate a server with a target host. # If requested_destination is reset, the server is moved to a host # that is not a requested target host. # If requested_destination is not reset, the server comes back to # the original (source) host because the target host is down. self.api.post_server_action( server['id'], {'os-migrateLive': {'host': target_host, 'block_migration': 'auto'}}) expected_params = {'OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host': original_host, 'status': 'ACTIVE'} server = self._wait_for_server_parameter(self.api, server, expected_params) # Make sure 'is_bfv' is set. reqspec = objects.RequestSpec.get_by_instance_uuid(self.ctxt, server['id']) self.assertIn('is_bfv', reqspec) self.assertFalse(reqspec.is_bfv) compute_id = self.api.get_services( self.api.put_service(compute_id, {'forced_down': 'true'}) self.assertFalse(reqspec.is_bfv)
deleted_lines: Tests the following two cases here. The following two cases are not tested here because * Live migration without a destination host. source_compute_id = self.api.get_services( self.api.put_service( source_compute_id, {'forced_down': 'true'}) self.assertIs(reqspec.is_bfv, False) source_compute_id = self.api.get_services( self.api.put_service( source_compute_id, {'forced_down': 'true'}) self.assertIs(reqspec.is_bfv, False)

commit_message:
List/show all server migration types

Add 'server migration list' and 'server migration show' command.

* openstack server migration list [--type <type>] [--long] <server>
* openstack server migration show <server> <migration>

Depends-On: I02305d3df61b7a37e20d3f5339e4820f83a0693d
Depends-On: I96ee551cac0b10c40b6f9edc5d068e91b6c84406
Change-Id: Ib3c4de29db2cc7778da23dc074646fa4d8200e46
Implements: blueprint list-show-all-server-migration-types
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/19/450119/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MIGRATION_COLUMNS = ( "ID", "Server UUID", "Type", "Status", "Source Compute", "Source Node", "Dest Compute", "Dest Node", "Dest Host", "Memory Processed Bytes", "Memory Remaining Bytes", "Memory Total Bytes", "Disk Processed Bytes", "Disk Remaining Bytes", "Disk Total Bytes", "Created At", "Updated At", ) class ListMigration(command.Lister): _description = _("List server migrations") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ListMigration, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'server', metavar='<server>', help=_('Server to list migrations (name or ID)'), ) parser.add_argument( "--type", metavar="<type>", default=None, help=_('Migration type ("live-migration", ' '"migration", "resize" or "evacuation")') ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute target_server = utils.find_resource(compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server) data = compute_client.server_migrations.list( target_server, migration_type=parsed_args.type) return (MIGRATION_COLUMNS, (utils.get_item_properties( s, MIGRATION_COLUMNS, ) for s in data)) class ShowMigration(command.ShowOne): _description = _("Show server migration") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ShowMigration, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'server', metavar='<server>', help=_('Server to show migration (name or ID)'), ) parser.add_argument( 'migration', metavar='<migration>', help=_('Migration to show (ID)'), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute target_server = utils.find_resource(compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server) data = compute_client.server_migrations.get( target_server, parsed_args.migration) return (MIGRATION_COLUMNS, utils.get_item_properties( data, MIGRATION_COLUMNS))

commit_message:
compute: Extract _get_bdm_image_metadata into nova.utils

This function extracts image metadata from a given block_device_mapping
and is extremely useful outside of the compute API. This change simply
extracts the function into nova.utils alongside
get_image_metadata_from_volume and other similar functions.

Change-Id: I8ba52f0cd877cefc1f7d3c10d8a07a2a1c21cb34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/705212/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: boot_meta = utils.get_bdm_image_metadata( context, self.image_api, self.volume_api, block_device_mapping, legacy_bdm)
deleted_lines: def _get_bdm_image_metadata(self, context, block_device_mapping, legacy_bdm=True): """If we are booting from a volume, we need to get the volume details from Cinder and make sure we pass the metadata back accordingly. """ if not block_device_mapping: return {} for bdm in block_device_mapping: if (legacy_bdm and block_device.get_device_letter( bdm.get('device_name', '')) != 'a'): continue elif not legacy_bdm and bdm.get('boot_index') != 0: continue volume_id = bdm.get('volume_id') snapshot_id = bdm.get('snapshot_id') if snapshot_id: # NOTE(alaski): A volume snapshot inherits metadata from the # originating volume, but the API does not expose metadata # on the snapshot itself. So we query the volume for it below. snapshot = self.volume_api.get_snapshot(context, snapshot_id) volume_id = snapshot['volume_id'] if bdm.get('image_id'): try: image_id = bdm['image_id'] image_meta = self.image_api.get(context, image_id) return image_meta except Exception: raise exception.InvalidBDMImage(id=image_id) elif volume_id: try: volume = self.volume_api.get(context, volume_id) except exception.CinderConnectionFailed: raise except Exception: raise exception.InvalidBDMVolume(id=volume_id) if not volume.get('bootable', True): raise exception.InvalidBDMVolumeNotBootable(id=volume_id) return utils.get_image_metadata_from_volume(volume) return {} boot_meta = self._get_bdm_image_metadata( context, block_device_mapping, legacy_bdm)

commit_message:
libvirt: Break up get_disk_mapping within blockinfo

As requested in I0e1241ae691afd2af12ef15706c454c05d9f932c this change
simply breaks up the huge get_disk_mapping function into smaller self
contained functions.

Change-Id: Ia15f9281ed1efcb89a83f6ef426b3294754f2bc5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/714962/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if rescue and rescue_image_meta is None: return _get_rescue_disk_mapping( virt_type, instance, disk_bus, image_meta) mapping = _get_disk_mapping( virt_type, instance, disk_bus, cdrom_bus, image_meta, block_device_info) if rescue and rescue_image_meta: mapping = _get_stable_device_rescue_mapping( virt_type, instance, mapping, rescue_image_meta) return mapping def _get_rescue_disk_mapping(virt_type, instance, disk_bus, image_meta): """Build disk mapping for a legacy instance rescue This legacy method of rescue requires that the rescue device is attached first, ahead of the original root disk and optional config drive. :param virt_type: Virt type used by libvirt. :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object :param disk_bus: Disk bus to use within the mapping :param image_meta: objects.image_meta.ImageMeta for the instance :returns: Disk mapping for the given instance """ mapping = {} rescue_info = get_next_disk_info(mapping, disk_bus, boot_index=1) mapping['disk.rescue'] = rescue_info mapping['root'] = rescue_info os_info = get_next_disk_info(mapping, disk_bus) mapping['disk'] = os_info if configdrive.required_by(instance): device_type = get_config_drive_type() disk_bus = get_disk_bus_for_device_type(instance, virt_type, image_meta, device_type) config_info = get_next_disk_info(mapping, disk_bus, device_type) mapping['disk.config.rescue'] = config_info return mapping def _get_disk_mapping(virt_type, instance, disk_bus, cdrom_bus, image_meta, block_device_info): """Build disk mapping for a given instance :param virt_type: Virt type used by libvirt. :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object :param disk_bus: Disk bus to use within the mapping :param cdrom_bus: CD-ROM bus to use within the mapping :param image_meta: objects.image_meta.ImageMeta for the instance :param block_device_info: dict detailing disks and volumes attached :returns: Disk mapping for the given instance. """ mapping = {} return mapping def _get_stable_device_rescue_mapping(virt_type, instance, mapping, rescue_image_meta): """Add a rescue device to an existing disk mapping for stable rescue This method of rescue uses the original disk mapping of the instance before attaching the rescue device last. :param virt_type: Virt type used by libvirt. :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance object :param mapping: Existing disk mapping for the instance :param rescue_image_meta: objects.image_meta.ImageMeta of the rescue image :returns: Disk mapping dict with rescue device added. """ rescue_device = get_rescue_device(rescue_image_meta) rescue_bus = get_rescue_bus(instance, virt_type, rescue_image_meta, rescue_device) rescue_info = get_next_disk_info(mapping, rescue_bus, device_type=rescue_device) mapping['disk.rescue'] = rescue_info
deleted_lines: mapping = {} if rescue and rescue_image_meta is None: rescue_info = get_next_disk_info(mapping, disk_bus, boot_index=1) mapping['disk.rescue'] = rescue_info mapping['root'] = rescue_info os_info = get_next_disk_info(mapping, disk_bus) mapping['disk'] = os_info if configdrive.required_by(instance): device_type = get_config_drive_type() disk_bus = get_disk_bus_for_device_type(instance, virt_type, image_meta, device_type) config_info = get_next_disk_info(mapping, disk_bus, device_type) mapping['disk.config.rescue'] = config_info return mapping # NOTE(lyarwood): This can only be a stable device rescue so add the rescue # disk as the final disk in the mapping. if rescue and rescue_image_meta: rescue_device = get_rescue_device(rescue_image_meta) rescue_bus = get_rescue_bus(instance, virt_type, rescue_image_meta, rescue_device) rescue_info = get_next_disk_info(mapping, rescue_bus, device_type=rescue_device) mapping['disk.rescue'] = rescue_info

commit_message:
Provide the parent pGPU when creating a new vGPU

Now that all compute node Resource Providers are reshaped (since Stein),
we know that each of them have children RPs if they have pGPUs.

That's why we can now pass the parent PCI ID (for the pGPU) when wanting
to create a new vGPU (ie. a mdev for libvirt).

NOTE(sbauza) : The current reshape functional test for VGPUs simulates
an old compute (pre-Stein) by creating by hand VGPU inventories on the
root RP and then creating the instances to the Nova API for making sure
that the guest XML will be written. This is OK but requires the
_allocate_mdev() code to be able to support non-reshaped VGPU
inventories.
Given moving to grenade checking the VGPU reshape testing wouldn't be
trivial, we accept to still provide support for non-nested RPs in this
specific _allocate_mdevs() libvirt. This sucks a bit, but we need to
keep it for a while and that doesn't harm.

Partially-Implements: blueprint vgpu-multiple-types

Change-Id: I6a1cebb6676b20b76e451fc3bde5ea54bbf16ff7

commit_message:
Release final python-novaclient for ussuri

Final ussuri client lib release for the April 9 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Ib6dfb66f318129b11e10ab5084ccd9c6a5291856
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: I18032bd40489c4b1c511713b0f1c5bb1aca7c1d2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-07 19:15:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/985bcec8b2e5894495a378b513a45258a8e97f14', 'message': 'WIP compute: Report COMPUTE_BFV_RESCUE and check during rescue

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-01-14 08:46:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ebb8149049999a17289cbdca4fc3ce704d3aca26', 'message': 'WIP compute: Report COMPUTE_BFV_RESCUE and check during rescue

This change introduces and checks the COMPUTE_BFV_RESCUE trait during
instance rescue.

An additional kwarg ``allow_bfv_rescue`` flag is also added to the
signature of the rescue method within the compute API. This defaults to
False and will be used in a following change to indicate when the
request is using a high enough microversion to invoke this new
capability.

This is WIP until the following change is released in os-traits:
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/694033/

Change-Id: Ic2ad1468d31b7707b7f8f2b845a9cf47d9d076d5
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2020-01-31 12:58:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/843c78277ebaf228a63de4fa3f8d51afbc0c5375', 'message': 'compute: Report COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV and check during rescue

This change introduces the COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV trait and checks that a
given compute reports it when attempting to rescue a boot from volume
instance.

An additional kwarg ``allow_bfv_rescue`` flag is also added to the
signature of the rescue method within the compute API. This defaults to
False and will be used in a following change to indicate when the
request is using a high enough microversion to invoke this new
capability.

Implements: blueprint virt-bfv-instance-rescue
Change-Id: Ic2ad1468d31b7707b7f8f2b845a9cf47d9d076d5
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2020-02-04 10:45:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fe71eeb87aaf1420ac672209d8fe5878a9edb07d', 'message': 'compute: Report COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV and check during rescue

This change introduces and checks the COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV trait in the
compute layer during an instance rescue when the instance boots from a
volume.

An additional kwarg ``allow_bfv_rescue`` flag is also added to the
signature of the rescue method within the compute API. This defaults to
False and will be used in a following change to indicate when the
request is using a high enough microversion to invoke this new
capability.

The ``supports_bfv_rescue`` capability tracked within the virt drivers
that this trait maps to is only added to the powervm driver for now due
to the way in which these capabilities are checked by the
``TestPowerVMDriver.test_driver_capabilities`` test.

Implements: blueprint virt-bfv-instance-rescue
Change-Id: Ic2ad1468d31b7707b7f8f2b845a9cf47d9d076d5
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2020-02-05 16:40:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/494042da1f2b7423837324a8a28afe380610990d', 'message': 'compute: Report COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV and check during rescue

commit_message:
compute: Report COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV and check during rescue

This change introduces and checks the COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV trait that was
introduced in os-traits 2.2.0 in the compute layer during an instance
rescue when the instance boots from a volume.

An additional kwarg ``allow_bfv_rescue`` flag is also added to the
signature of the rescue method within the compute API. This defaults to
False and will be used in a following change to indicate when the
request is using a high enough microversion to invoke this new
capability.

The ``supports_bfv_rescue`` capability tracked within the virt drivers
that this trait maps to is only added to the powervm driver for now due
to the way in which these capabilities are checked by the
``TestPowerVMDriver.test_driver_capabilities`` test.

Implements: blueprint virt-bfv-instance-rescue
Change-Id: Ic2ad1468d31b7707b7f8f2b845a9cf47d9d076d5

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I749d6ebdef9163ffa3135778a4accbb8be5ba9e3

subject: [CI] Stop gating with manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-10 20:21:25.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/14d081acf6d7eb3f54168070652510625f35bf09', 'message': '[CI] Stop gating with manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm

The job manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm is functionally
identical to manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-ipv6-only.
Semantically, the only difference being that the service
host, and in turn the endpoint base for manila, and the
communication address for rabbitmq, mysql and other infra
services.

manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-ipv6-only
has MANILA_SERVICE_HOST set to an IPv6 address,
for example:
MANILA_SERVICE_HOST='[::1]'
MANILA_ENDPOINT_BASE='http://[::1]:8786'

manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm has MANILA_SERVICE_HOST
set to an IPv4 address, for example:
MANILA_SERVICE_HOST='23.253.236.222'
MANILA_ENDPOINT_BASE='http://23.253.236.222:8786'

So lets drop the job enforcing IPv4 service host since
we have coverage for that scenario in other jobs that
we're running, including the voting
manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-dummy job.

I'd like to backport this change to stable/train
during which this job was duplicated to cover the scenario
of doing "ipv6-only" service host testing [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682716/

Change-Id: I51dc25889c1d1fb361f0be6f8c0aa47ca64c9aaa
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[CI] Stop gating with manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm

The job manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm is functionally
identical to manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-ipv6-only.
Semantically, the only difference being that the service
host, and in turn the endpoint base for manila, and the
communication address for rabbitmq, mysql and other infra
services.

manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-ipv6-only
has MANILA_SERVICE_HOST set to an IPv6 address,
for example:
MANILA_SERVICE_HOST='[::1]'
MANILA_ENDPOINT_BASE='http://[::1]:8786'

manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm has MANILA_SERVICE_HOST
set to an IPv4 address, for example:
MANILA_SERVICE_HOST='23.253.236.222'
MANILA_ENDPOINT_BASE='http://23.253.236.222:8786'

So lets drop the job enforcing IPv4 service host since
we have coverage for that scenario in other jobs that
we're running, including the voting
manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-dummy job.

I'd like to backport this change to stable/train
during which this job was duplicated to cover the scenario
of doing "ipv6-only" service host testing [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682716/

Change-Id: I51dc25889c1d1fb361f0be6f8c0aa47ca64c9aaa
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: [NetApp] Fix driver to honor standard extra specs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-07 10:54:19.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/lib_base.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1707084-netapp-manila-driver-to-honour-std-extra-specs-d32fae4e9411b503.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/678ea79f85e53ec21a0fb74758875b3a7ebe1aa7', 'message': "[NetApp] Fix driver to honor standard extra specs

During migration and manage/unmanage operations, if we used standard
extra_specs format (e.g. 'thin_provisioning'='True') instead of
NetApp based extra_specs format (e.g. 'netapp:thin_provisioned'='True'),
NetApp driver used to ignore these standard extra_specs settings
and continued the operation with the default option.
The driver is now fixed to handle this issue by honouring the
standard extra_specs during migration and manage/unmanage.

Change-Id: I48f4d966201fc8d6bd6eec0c37f1575b434310e7
Closes-Bug: #1707084
(cherry picked from commit 9250e02b56fa4a0d93fe4c32cdfac4eceab8d095)
"}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix driver to honor standard extra specs

During migration and manage/unmanage operations, if we used standard
extra_specs format (e.g. 'thin_provisioning'='True') instead of
NetApp based extra_specs format (e.g. 'netapp:thin_provisioned'='True'),
NetApp driver used to ignore these standard extra_specs settings
and continued the operation with the default option.
The driver is now fixed to handle this issue by honouring the
standard extra_specs during migration and manage/unmanage.

Change-Id: I48f4d966201fc8d6bd6eec0c37f1575b434310e7
Closes-Bug: #1707084
(cherry picked from commit 9250e02b56fa4a0d93fe4c32cdfac4eceab8d095)

commit_message:
Include uc plan var when TripleoInventories contains a single plan

I2cc721676005536b14995980f7a042991c92adcc switched to using TripleoInventories
for both single and multi stack inventories. However the 'plan' undercloud var
was no longer set.
Restore this for single stack inventories only to keep compatibility.

Change-Id: I5735cfaa5fe59eabde66b3370a2c5838ff0c4b23
Related-bug: #1849073

subject: Cleanup py27 support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-10 09:48:10.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/solum-specs/commit/71013aed2132a82e7857672f074bdebb4a290f8d', 'message': 'Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Switch to openstackdocstheme, update requirements for this
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: If26e126d88b33cd45a72932d1b271f7f08d50652
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Switch to openstackdocstheme, update requirements for this
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: If26e126d88b33cd45a72932d1b271f7f08d50652
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum-specs refs/changes/54/718954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}commands = python setup.py build_sphinx

subject: Update master for stable/ussuri
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-10 12:00:42.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/ussuri.rst', 'releasenotes/source/index.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/cc69cf531ead06cf33654de32b14354fbe139db1', 'message': 'Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I15fca41fbe715469ccc22389de9cbf526ae3f211
Sem-Ver: feature
'}]
commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I15fca41fbe715469ccc22389de9cbf526ae3f211
Sem-Ver: feature
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/82/718982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: Add support for stable device rescue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-31 14:33:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7a20d098047690fdb6012a5243e48f7f8004a0a0', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Add support for stable device rescue

This change introduces a new method of instance rescue to the Libvirt
driver where the original storage devices remain attached in their
original order to the instance during a rescue. This differs from the
original method where only the rescue disk, original root disk and
recreated config drive would be attached.

This new method is controlled by the presence of hw_rescue_device and
hw_rescue_bus image metadata properties on the image provided as part of
the request to rescue the instance. As their name suggests these
properties control the device and bus type used to attach the rescue
device to the instance. Allowing users to rescue instances using more
traditional media such as USB disks or CD-ROM ISOs.

While the rescue disk is attached last to the instance we are able to
boot directly from it using the boot element and order attribute when
defining the disk within the Libvirt domain [1]. This is not however
supported for Xen or LXC virt types and as a result this new method is
not available for these types.

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsNICSBoot

Change-Id: I0e1241ae691afd2af12ef15706c454c05d9f932c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-12-31 15:27:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c9019235bc620bc0b5e1002f6edd3b9be5d188b9', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Add support for stable device rescue

This change introduces a new method of instance rescue to the Libvirt
driver where the original storage devices remain attached in their
original order to the instance during a rescue. This differs from the
original method where only the rescue disk, original root disk and
recreated config drive would be attached.

This new method is controlled by the presence of hw_rescue_device and
hw_rescue_bus image metadata properties on the image provided as part of
the request to rescue the instance. As their name suggests these
properties control the device and bus type used to attach the rescue
device to the instance. Allowing users to rescue instances using more
traditional media such as USB disks or CD-ROM ISOs.

While the rescue disk is attached last to the instance we are able to
boot directly from it using the boot element and order attribute when
defining the disk within the Libvirt domain [1]. This is not however
supported for Xen or LXC virt types and as a result this new method is
not available for these types.

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsNICSBoot

Change-Id: I0e1241ae691afd2af12ef15706c454c05d9f932c
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2020-01-01 19:43:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/125f7a58fc55ddee4b6463e69b2aa8da6f009623', 'message': 'libvirt: Add support for stable device rescue

This change introduces a new method of instance rescue to the Libvirt
driver where all original devices remain attached in their original
order. This differs from the original method of instance rescue where
only the rescue boot disk, original root disk and optional regenerated
config drive would be attached.

This new method is controlled and enabled by the presence of
hw_rescue_device and hw_rescue_bus image metadata properties on the
image provided as part of rescue request. As their name suggests these
properties control the device and bus type used to attach the rescue
boot device to the instance. The properties will allow users to rescue
instances using more traditional bare metal rescue media such as USB
disks or CD-ROM ISOs.

While the rescue disk is attached last to the instance we are able to
boot directly from it using the boot element and order attribute when
defining the disk within the Libvirt domain [1]. This is not however
supported for Xen or LXC virt types and as a result this new method is
not available for these types.

To enable this new mode and building on I9c2d9013d741774e521021913ec0 we
can now provide the full block_device_info for the instance when
building the disk mapping where we now add the rescue boot device. This
now allows instances with attached volumes to be rescued. Boot from
volume instances however are still not supported and blocked within the
compute API. Future work will remove this restriction.

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsNICSBoot

Change-Id: I0e1241ae691afd2af12ef15706c454c05d9f932c
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2020-01-07 19:15:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1d739a24917d2ee457bbfdd1189d38b814ff8c32', 'message': 'libvirt: Add support for stable device rescue

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2020-01-16 15:35:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ea5aa8495a23f7776fbcc70c6764a0be21d7fd06', 'message': 'libvirt: Add support for stable device rescue

This change introduces a new method of instance rescue to the Libvirt
driver where all original devices remain attached in their original
order while booting from the provided rescue image. This differs from
the original method of instance rescue where only the rescue disk,
original root disk and regenerated config drive would be attached.

This new method is enabled by the presence of either the
hw_rescue_device or hw_rescue_bus image metadata properties on the
provided rescue image. As their name suggests these properties control
the device and bus type used to attach the rescue boot device to the
instance. The properties will allow users to rescue instances using the
emulated equivalents of more traditional bare metal rescue media such as
USB disks or CD-ROM ISOs.

While the rescue disk is attached last to the instance we are able to
boot directly from it using the boot element and order attribute when
defining the disk within the Libvirt domain [1]. This is not however
supported for Xen or LXC virt types and as a result this new method is
not available for these types.

To enable this new mode and building on I9c2d9013d741774e521021913ec0 we
can now provide the full block_device_info for the instance when
building the disk mapping where we now add the rescue boot device. This
now allows instances with attached volumes to be rescued. Boot from
volume instances however are still not supported and blocked within the
compute API. Future work will remove this restriction.

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsNICSBoot

Implements: blueprint virt-rescue-stable-disk-devices
Change-Id: I0e1241ae691afd2af12ef15706c454c05d9f932c

original root disk and regenerated config drive would be attached.

This new method is enabled by the presence of either the
hw_rescue_device or hw_rescue_bus image metadata properties on the
provided rescue image. As their name suggests these properties control
the device and bus type used to attach the rescue boot device to the
instance. The properties will allow users to rescue instances using the
emulated equivalents of more traditional bare metal rescue media such as
USB disks or CD-ROM ISOs.

While the rescue disk is attached last to the instance we are able to
boot directly from it using the boot element and order attribute when
defining the disk within the Libvirt domain [1]. This is not however
supported for Xen or LXC virt types and as a result this new method is
not available for these types.

To enable this new mode and building on I9c2d9013d741774e521021913ec0 we
can now provide the full block_device_info for the instance when
building the disk mapping where we now add the rescue boot device. This
now allows instances with attached volumes to be rescued. Boot from
volume instances however are still not supported and blocked within the
compute API. Future work will remove this restriction.

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsNICSBoot

Implements: blueprint virt-rescue-stable-disk-devices
Change-Id: I0e1241ae691afd2af12ef15706c454c05d9f932c

commit_message:
libvirt: Add support for stable device rescue

This change introduces a new method of instance rescue to the Libvirt
driver where all original devices remain attached in their original
order while booting from the provided rescue image. This differs from
the original method of instance rescue where only the rescue disk,
original root disk and regenerated config drive would be attached.

This new method is enabled by the presence of either the
hw_rescue_device or hw_rescue_bus image metadata properties on the
provided rescue image. As their name suggests these properties control
the device and bus type used to attach the rescue boot device to the
instance. The properties will allow users to rescue instances using the
emulated equivalents of more traditional bare metal rescue media such as
USB disks or CD-ROM ISOs.

While the rescue disk is attached last to the instance we are able to
boot directly from it using the boot element and order attribute when
defining the disk within the Libvirt domain [1]. This is not however
supported for Xen or LXC virt types and as a result this new method is
not available for these types.

To enable this new mode and building on I9c2d9013d741774e521021913ec0 we
can now provide the full block_device_info for the instance when
building the disk mapping where we now add the rescue boot device. This
now allows instances with attached volumes to be rescued. Boot from
volume instances however are still not supported and blocked within the
compute API. Future work will remove this restriction.

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsNICSBoot

Implements: blueprint virt-rescue-stable-disk-devices
Change-Id: I0e1241ae691afd2af12ef15706c454c05d9f932c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/700812/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('nova.objects.block_device.BlockDeviceMapping.save') @mock.patch('nova.objects.image_meta.ImageMeta.from_image_ref') def _test_rescue(self, instance, mock_instance_metadata, mock_supports_direct_io, mock_build_device_metadata, mock_set_host_enabled, mock_write_to_file, mock_get_mdev, mock_get_image_meta_by_ref, mock_bdm_save, image_meta_dict=None, exists=None, instance_image_meta_dict=None, block_device_info=None): if instance_image_meta_dict: meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(instance_image_meta_dict) mock_get_image_meta_by_ref.return_value = meta with test.nested( mock.patch.object(self.drvr, '_create_domain', side_effect=fake_create_domain), mock.patch.object(self.drvr, '_connect_volume'), ) as (mock_create_domain, mock_connect_volume): network_info, image_meta, rescue_password, block_device_info) @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.utils.write_to_file') def test_rescue_stable_device_unsupported_virt_types(self, mock_libvirt_write_to_file): network_info = _fake_network_info(self, 1) instance = self._create_instance({'config_drive': str(True)}) rescue_image_meta_dict = {'id': uuids.rescue_image_id, 'name': 'rescue', 'properties': {'hw_rescue_device': 'disk', 'hw_rescue_bus': 'virtio'}} rescue_image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(rescue_image_meta_dict) # Assert that InstanceNotRescuable is raised for xen and lxc virt_types self.flags(virt_type='xen', group='libvirt') self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceNotRescuable, self.drvr.rescue, self.context, instance, network_info, rescue_image_meta, None, None) self.flags(virt_type='lxc', group='libvirt') self.assertRaises(exception.InstanceNotRescuable, self.drvr.rescue, self.context, instance, network_info, rescue_image_meta, None, None) def test_rescue_stable_device(self): # Assert the imagebackend behaviour and domain device layout instance = self._create_instance({'config_drive': str(True)}) inst_image_meta_dict = {'id': uuids.image_id, 'name': 'fake'} rescue_image_meta_dict = {'id': uuids.rescue_image_id, 'name': 'rescue', 'properties': {'hw_rescue_device': 'disk', 'hw_rescue_bus': 'virtio'}} block_device_info = {'root_device_name': '/dev/vda', 'ephemerals': [ {'guest_format': None, 'disk_bus': 'virtio', 'device_name': '/dev/vdb', 'size': 20, 'device_type': 'disk'}], 'swap': None, 'block_device_mapping': None} backend, domain = self._test_rescue( instance, image_meta_dict=rescue_image_meta_dict, instance_image_meta_dict=inst_image_meta_dict, block_device_info=block_device_info) # Assert that we created the expected set of disks, and no others self.assertEqual(['disk.rescue', 'kernel.rescue', 'ramdisk.rescue'], sorted(backend.created_disks.keys())) # Assert that the original disks are presented first with the rescue # disk attached as the final device in the domain. expected_disk_paths = [backend.disks[name].path for name in ('disk', 'disk.eph0', 'disk.config', 'disk.rescue')] disk_paths = domain.xpath('devices/disk/source/@file') self.assertEqual(expected_disk_paths, disk_paths) # Assert that the disk.rescue device has a boot order of 1 disk_path = backend.disks['disk.rescue'].path query = "devices/disk[source/@file = '%s']/boot/@order" % disk_path self.assertEqual('1', domain.xpath(query)[0]) def test_rescue_stable_device_with_volume_attached(self): # Assert the imagebackend behaviour and domain device layout instance = self._create_instance({'config_drive': str(True)}) inst_image_meta_dict = {'id': uuids.image_id, 'name': 'fake'} rescue_image_meta_dict = {'id': uuids.rescue_image_id, 'name': 'rescue', 'properties': {'hw_rescue_device': 'disk', 'hw_rescue_bus': 'virtio'}} conn_info = {'driver_volume_type': 'iscsi', 'data': {'device_path': '/dev/sdb'}} bdm = objects.BlockDeviceMapping( self.context, **fake_block_device.FakeDbBlockDeviceDict({ 'id': 1, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'device_name': '/dev/vdd'})) bdms = driver_block_device.convert_volumes([bdm]) block_device_info = {'root_device_name': '/dev/vda', 'ephemerals': [ {'guest_format': None, 'disk_bus': 'virtio', 'device_name': '/dev/vdb', 'size': 20, 'device_type': 'disk'}], 'swap': None, 'block_device_mapping': bdms} bdm = block_device_info['block_device_mapping'][0] bdm['connection_info'] = conn_info backend, domain = self._test_rescue( instance, image_meta_dict=rescue_image_meta_dict, instance_image_meta_dict=inst_image_meta_dict, block_device_info=block_device_info) # Assert that we created the expected set of disks, and no others self.assertEqual(['disk.rescue', 'kernel.rescue', 'ramdisk.rescue'], sorted(backend.created_disks.keys())) # Assert that the original disks are presented first with the rescue # disk attached as the final device in the domain. expected_disk_paths = [ backend.disks['disk'].path, backend.disks['disk.eph0'].path, backend.disks['disk.config'].path, '/dev/sdb', backend.disks['disk.rescue'].path] query = 'devices/disk/source/@*[name()="file" or name()="dev"]' disk_paths = domain.xpath(query) self.assertEqual(expected_disk_paths, disk_paths) # Assert that the disk.rescue device has a boot order of 1 disk_path = backend.disks['disk.rescue'].path query = "devices/disk[source/@file = '%s']/boot/@order" % disk_path self.assertEqual('1', domain.xpath(query)[0])

commit_message:
Use placement stable version for functional job

nova-tox-functional is py2 job and need placement as required project.
and started failing for incompatible py version:

ERROR: Package 'openstack-placement' requires a different Python: 2.7.17 not in '>=3.6'

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b460a8c59ad64e57b871aa3c00638b01/log/job-output.txt#782

Placement master is now py3 only which mean master version will stop
working on py2 env:
- I6f458fb60b5a33b5aa2ce3ab292862ab98eb4670

Current tox env mention the placement master link as deps, where need to use
the stable version for stable jobs. Making deps with version not the
fresh git clone like how other test-requirements.txt deps work.

Change-Id: Ib5f70f4bbfde8672507adebdbc4e411b5db39bb8

commit_message:
Use placement stable branch version for functional job

nova-tox-functional is py2 job and need placement as required project.
and started failing for incompatible py version:

ERROR: Package 'openstack-placement' requires a different Python: 2.7.17 not in '>=3.6'

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b460a8c59ad64e57b871aa3c00638b01/log/job-output.txt#782

Placement master is now py3 only which mean master version will stop
working on py2 env:
- I6f458fb60b5a33b5aa2ce3ab292862ab98eb4670

We should use the stable version of placement on stable jobs.

Change-Id: Ib5f70f4bbfde8672507adebdbc4e411b5db39bb8

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I979c219b5ddc2ef709173b17a29172f18ff15cae

commit_message:
Microversion 2.87 - Stable device boot from volume rescue

This microversion is used to request a stable device rescue for boot
from volume instances and will only succeed when the compute hosting the
instance reports the COMPUTE_RESCUE_BFV trait.

No changes are required within novaclient so this change only bumps
API_MAX_VERSION.


Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701430/

Change-Id: I7885b8558db7657abbfe1f45877f52e947f5f655

Add the ability to manage RAID settings

settings.
